materials.raw_text: Co: 10 g, Hg: 20 g, In: 30 g, Tm: 15 g

sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt powder) - Chemical supply stores; Hg (Mercury) - Specialized chemical suppliers or licensed dealers; In (Indium) - Metal suppliers or online marketplaces; Tm (Thulium) - Rare earth metal suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt powder) - Chemical supply stores; Hg (Mercury) - Specialized chemical suppliers or licensed dealers; In (Indium) - Metal suppliers or online marketplaces; Tm (Thulium) - Rare earth metal suppliers.
1. Weigh each ingredient using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing bowl, combine Co, Hg, In, and Tm. 3. Mix thoroughly using a spatula to ensure uniform distribution of all elements.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing bowl, combine Co, Hg, In, and Tm. 3. Mix thoroughly using a spatula to ensure uniform distribution of all elements.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the mixed ingredients in a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the mixed ingredients in a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool slowly to room temperature. 2. This process should take approximately 4-6 hours to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool slowly to room temperature. 2. This process should take approximately 4-6 hours to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the alloy from the crucible. 2. Use a file or sanding paper to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to preserve the surface and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the alloy from the crucible. 2. Use a file or sanding paper to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to preserve the surface and prevent oxidation.
